info.title: Swagger Petstore
info.description: This is a sample server Petstore server.  You can find out more about Swagger at [http://swagger.io](http://swagger.io) or on [irc.freenode.net, #swagger](http://swagger.io/irc/). For this sample, you can use the api key `special-key` to test the authorization filters.

post.description:
Starts an authorization flow for an existing Cash App customer to grant
account permissions. The customer enters the flow by visiting the redirect_url in the
response or scanning the QR image provided by qr_url.

If the customer approves the request for the scopes specified, they will be directed to
redirect_uri with an Authorization Code and State in the query parameters to continue the
flow. The integration retrieves the Authorization Code from the redirect and uses it with
the Access Token endpoint below.

Once the customer has accepted or declined the authorization request, they will be
[redirected](doc:mobile-redirects) back to the client-specified redirect_uri. A
[webhook event](doc:webhooks) is also generated if the client server is configured to
receive them.

200.description: Assorted values needed for continuing the authorization process.

scopes.description: A list of [scopes](doc:scopes) requested from the customer

state.description: An opaque value used by the client to maintain state between request and callback.

customer_descriptor.description: A short descriptor visible in Cash App for "$Cashtag on File" experiences

redirect_url.description: A uri used to redirect the customer's user-agent after the customer approves or denies the app integration.

scopes.description: The permissions being requested on the access-token for use by the application. This must be a subset of the scopes requested in during authorization.

authorization_code.description: A temporary authorization grant, used to exchange for an access and refresh token. NOTE: Cannot be combined with `refresh_token`

refresh_token.description: A permanent, revokable authorization grant, used to generate refresh tokens without customer intervention. NOTE: Cannot be combined with `authorization_code`

redirect_url.description: A Cash url to redirect the customer to the Application approval flow.

qr_url.description: A Cash URL used to render a QR code image (PNG format)

expires_in.description: The lifetime  of this authorization flow in seconds. Null indicates that it does not expire.

customer_id.description: An auto-generated id to represent the newly authorized customer.

refresh_token.description: A long-lived resource credential that can be used to obtain new access tokens. [RFC-6749](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.5)

access_token.description: A short-lived authentication token that will authorize actions taken on a resource based on the scopes granted by the resource owner. [RFC-6749](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.4)

expires_in.description: The expiry duration of the access token (in seconds)
